Entries.default: "It just me, or do we end up killing a lot of spiders?"
"Nothing a little fire can't fix."
"Their size matters not. Crush them all."
"Some of nature's wonders are... less wonderful than others."
"I knock critters like you out of my boots every morning."
"I think they be looking at me, cap..."
"Try not to burn them. Perhaps we can harvest the silk."
"Cu√®, a few spiders? The basement of the Dark Cupboard was full of spiders before I arrived."
"Not sure my boots are big enough for these fellas."
"Maybe I stay in the back this time, ta?"
"I'm going to dance on their heads and stomp on their... heads!"
"These things are best fought from a distance. Be careful."
"Stand firm against the darkness."
"The shadows seem to live, but what manner of life is this?"
"Hey captain, explain to me again why I can see these ghosts but not the other kind?"
"Let's show 'em the light, Watcher!"
"Think you might be putting them to work on your boat, cap?"
"Careful. These feed on the raw life of the living."
"I'm dead and I'm angry, woe is me."
"I am not afraid of the dark."
"I got a song or two just for them."
"Can I hit the shadows?"
"Those folk look all blurry."
"I take no joy in killing intelligent beasts. Let's be through with this quickly."
"I will never get used to the smell."
"Ah, it seems a waste to kill such beasts - so handsome and in their prime."
"If you're thinking of buddying up to these fish like you did in Tikawara, now's not the time."
"Don't be trying to pet them, farmer!"
"We have lagufaeth in the White that Wends. They are... different."
"They're not even wearing armor."
"What sort of arena arms fish men against kith? Per complancanet."
"Is it wrong if I'm wonderin' how they might taste?"
"But they are... fish? With swords?"
"Aw, I hate lagoos! Ever since Aeldys had us scrubbing up Deadlight!"
"Hey Aloth, how bout you go first this time?"
"This brings me back to my academy days."
"Watch your step, Watcher."
"I'll follow your lead, captain. This could go any number of ways."
"Stay close. These two look pretty unhinged."
"Brother against brother? That's a crying shame."
"Where do you want me, captain? This may require a little thought."
"Stay light on your feet!"
"Be careful where you put your feet!"
"We fighting both of them, then? Or just one?"
"Hey, remember the old temple back in Gilded Vale? This ain't nothing like that."
"What do you suppose it's full of traps?"
"They know they cannot take it with them to the Beyond, and yet."
"Strange how we guard our tombs but let the living fend for themselves."
"This is good practice for the next time we desecrate a tomb."
"Hel ain't a place for gems and jewelry."
"Right fine practice for looting, this. Hope the plunder's fine, too."
"I have often admired the complexity of ancient defense mechanisms."
"Do you normally spend time in the halls of the dead? Why?"
"What do we fight this time - the ethics of grave robbery?"
"This doesn't feel right to me. This feel right to you?"
"Rizilas iwasa masak'uki."
"I'll take the quiet one."
"This should make for a refreshing change."
"Do not let them flank you."
"Let us put their silence to the test, captain."
"Let's make some noise, captain."
"Sure you don't want to say something? Your prayers, maybe?"
"Heh, means we be getting all the pithy one-liners."
"They are not as quiet as they would have you think."
"They will scream before long."
"Did you say something? I didn't think so."
"We'll have you singin' yet."
"Shh, do not think so loud!"
"Scurry scurry, little souls! We'll still find you!"
"Look, they saved us the trouble of fighting their bodies!"
"May the strongest soul win!"
"What secrets lie where the dead rest?"
"Yes! More ghosts to punch!"
"Ready, Watcher? Not that you've got a lot of choice in the matter."
"Fye, lat's hae't out, than!"
"For the Republics!"
"Let me know where you want me, captain. I am ready."
"Ready when you are, captain."
"Got my sickle sharpened for the harvest."
"Ain't normally one for exhibitionism, but let's be giving them a show, aye?!"
"Your end shall be slow and painful!"
"Time to put what I learned from Arkemyr to the test."
"Don't get cocky!"
"Tell me what to hit!"
"Ke ni tehun seliki hidu gawu."
"Drinks after, aye?"
"Everything's got a soul."
"Winner's the one that blinds the most eyes, Maia. The thing's got eyes, aye?"
"Hey Serafen, want to make this interesting? Whoever dies first has to haunt the captain."
"I've got your back, Fassina!"
"Caution will serve us better than speed!"
